subject: RE: [Read_Alphabet] Re: Dictionary Definitions
msgSnippet: Hello Jeff, I m thinking the correlation between the original dictionary s phonics and the Jerome KB mapping must have gotten messed up. What I ll do is check
messageBody:
Hello Jeff,
 
I'm thinking the correlation between the original dictionary's phonics and the Jerome KB mapping must have gotten messed up.
 
What I'll do is check into it and create an out put that is in plain text formatted, comma delimited. Column one will have the Orthodox character word and the 2nd column will have the Jerome KB phonic equivalent.
 
I'll try to get this out to you in a few days.
 
Chuck

From: jeff_smith_8992 [mailto:jeff_smith_8992@...]
Sent: Tuesday, August 17, 2004 8:19 PM
To: Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [Read_Alphabet] Re: Dictionary Definitions

Hi Chuck,

Have you had a chance to look into the problem with character #8,
keyword "THey", in your dictionary?  I've done a little more looking
and I was able to determine that in the QuikScript portion of the
dictionary  character #8 (which is the capital "H" key in the
QuikScript fonts) only appears in one word, "GILKISONS".  Is this
something you can correct?  Or is this a problem with the source
dictionary that you translated your dictionary from?

Thanks,
Jeff

--- In Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com, Chuck Peck <chuck091956@o...> wrote:
> Hi Jeff,
> 
> I
never noticed that. You're right. Thanks for the catch. I guess
I'm going
> to have to take a re-look at the dictionary and correct
that.
> 
> Thanks,
> Chuck
> 
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: jeff_smith_8992
[mailto:jeff_smith_8992@y...]
> Sent: Wednesday, August 04, 2004 1:02
PM
> To: Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: [Read_Alphabet]
Dictionary Definitions
>
>
> Hi Chuck,
>
>
Here's a quick question... I noticed that in the dictionary you
> posted,
the words, she and the, both start with the same QS symbol. Is
> this
correct, or should "the" start with the "deep consonant", that
> extends
below the bottom of the line (letter #8 in the QS manual)?
>
>
Thanks,
> Jeff

Hello Jeff,
 
I'm thinking the correlation between the original dictionary's phonics and
the Jerome KB mapping must have gotten messed up.
 
What I'll do is check into it and create an out put that is in plain text
formatted, comma delimited. Column one will have the Orthodox character word
and the 2nd column will have the Jerome KB phonic equivalent.
 
I'll try to get this out to you in a few days. 
 
Chuck


  _____

Hi Chuck,

Have you had a chance to look into the problem with character #8,
keyword "THey", in your dictionary?  I've done a little more looking
and I was able to determine that in the QuikScript portion of the
dictionary  character #8 (which is the capital "H" key in the
QuikScript fonts) only appears in one word, "GILKISONS".  Is this
something you can correct?  Or is this a problem with the source
dictionary that you translated your dictionary from?

Thanks,
Jeff
